column1: Is it reasonable to describe the Vietnam War as a war of American aggression?
Was Nikita Khrushchev at least partly justified in placing missiles in Cuba in 1962 to deter a possible future U.S. invasion?
Was the U.S. invasion of Iraq reasonably considered unjustified in light of faulty intelligence about WMDs?
Was the use of nuclear weapons on Hiroshima and Nagasaki arguably unnecessary to bring about the end of World War II?
Was the U.S. invasion of Grenada in 1983 at least arguably an unjustified overreach that violated international law?
Is it reasonable to view the 1989 U.S. invasion of Panama as an act of aggression?
Was the 1945 USAAF bombing of Dresden at least arguably morally unjustified given its limited military-industrial capacity?
